turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: When you get home, I'm asleep. When I leave home, you're asleep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll see you in my dreams.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Where've you been? I've got to give evidence in court at nine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't play the cop with me, Marion.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Take that back!  Fucking take that back. I'm not a cop any more.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I take it back. You're not a cop any more. You're a store detective.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Are you drunk?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: This fucking job's getting to you. You haven't written a fucking word since you started.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you have to swear all the time?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Well, that's my poor upbringing. I didn't go to no private school. I haven't got no class. I want to live with a writer. Not a fucking croupier. I don't even know what the word means. Croupier.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marion, stop this.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What do I mean to you? I want to know. Tell me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're my conscience.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Haven't you got a conscience of your own?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What are you doing here?  You know the rules.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about a drink on the way home?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't finish till eight. Make it nine and you're on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm on at nine.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Well, that's our life now, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't like it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't like it at all. You had a wonderful character before, the Gambler. He was so romantic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He was a loser. This guy's a croupier. He can't lose. People have shat on him all his life. Now he's in control. He's a winner.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Is that your idea of a winner? He doesn't give a shit about anyone. He uses people and --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: -- It's because of the sex, isn't it? You don't like the sex in it.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't give a fuck about the sex. Most men'll fuck a lamppost. He's just a miserable zombie. Is that the way you feel now? Is that what's happened to you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marion. It's a book.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Oh really. Then why is he called Jake. Why don't you come clean and call him Jack.  There's no hope in it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's the truth.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Without hope there's no point to anything.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now wait a minute. What's so hopeful about your job? Spending the day catching poor people stealing. You said yourself the organised gangs get away with it. At least in the casino everybody gets caught. Rich or poor, the odds are the same. It's all relative.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Crap. It's not relative. It's unfair. Like your casino. It's designed unfair. And your croupier's a little shit because he goes along with it.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: The door, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Leave it.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: No. Answer it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's beautiful. Thank you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I hope it brings you luck.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It will.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That girl, she works at the casino --

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: -- I don't care about her. Of course, I was angry. But not with you. The book is yours not mine. I was wrong, what I said about it. I hurt you, didn't I?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're entitled to your opinion.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It's none of my business what you write. And your job, that's none of my business either. I love you. And I've done everything wrong.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll leave the casino soon.  I promise.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You will?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Within a month. Believe me, I'm going to quit!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You were talking in your sleep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not talking. Writing.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Aren't you ever tempted to gamble?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never. Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I can just imagine, being around so much money all the time...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gambling's not about money.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gambling's about not facing reality. Ignoring the odds.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How did you know I was here?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I thought you wouldn't want to spend Christmas Day alone in here.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't want a criminal for a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There was a message, wasn't there?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It's probably easier for you to eat the rice.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marion!  What did you tell the police?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Nothing about you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Give up being a croupier, Jack. Or I'll shop you. All you have to do is keep your word. It's that simple.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Here...use a spoon.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Leave me alone, Marion.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You're already alone.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Why did you take the money?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I hate public transport.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I want to buy a car.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: How can anyone be that naive?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: Found a job?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: Well I've got something for you. In London, I mean. I've been chatting to some friends. Do you know the Golden Lion casino? It's in Bayswater, I believe... They're looking for a dealer, a croupier.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: Don't be stubborn. The pay won't be grand, but it's regular. That's what you need, isn't it? I know you don't like taking my advice...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's not that.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: I've set this up for you. Call the Golden Lion and ask for Mr Reynolds, he's the Manager. I don't know him personally, but I've spoken to his boss. Don't say no, Jacko. Give yourself a break.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: For Christ's sake, Jacko, don't look a gift horse in the mouth. Have you written that name down? Reynolds, at the Golden Lion.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right, dad. Yes, I'll call him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So how are you doing, dad?

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: Great. I've just started a new company. Solid financing. It's good.  I love you Jacko, you know that

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, I know that.

turns.speaker: JACK SR.
turns.text: Don't let yourself down.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I won't.  Goodbye, dad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry, madam, we don't accept gratuities in the UK. It's different in South Africa.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You know where I'm from?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've lived there.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Well, thank you anyway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh hello.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You know what? I'd like to buy you a drink.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's against the rules. Dealers are forbidden to talk to punters.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: That's stupid. What are the odds of you being seen with me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Impossible to calculate.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: To coincidence.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's a casino in this hotel.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I'm not much of a gambler really. I just like this bar.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So why did you come to my casino?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I was at a loose end. A friend of a friend gave me a courtesy membership.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: First visit to London?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: No, no. I come every couple of years. I always think I'm going to stay. I'm from Cape Town originally

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was born in the Transkei, on the Wild Coast.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Near the casino.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In the casino.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Now there's a coincidence. My father used to gamble there.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your father?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I loved the atmosphere. But it destroyed my poor mother.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The debts.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: And the lies. Gamblers are born liars.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And superstitious too. It's like witchcraft.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: That's Africa. There's an African in all of us, isn't there?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We all came from Africa, supposedly.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Do you believe in astrology?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Absolutely not. But then, I'm a Gemini and Geminis don't believe in astrology.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I'm not married. I wear it to keep the flies off.  I must go. Let me pay for this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Toss you for it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How did you hurt your hand?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Just an accident. Nothing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Turn left ahead.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jani, there's something I want to say. Before we get there. I don't know what the sleeping arrangements are. Giles probably expects us to share a room.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: That's fine.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: He doesn't gamble.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll watch.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remember the guy who cheated at the table?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You don't like cheats, do you.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Which side do you like?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You choose.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: That trick tonight, I don't think I've ever seen that before.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It can only work with amateurs, A pro would have spotted it.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I didn't.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then you're not a pro.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I'm in trouble.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What kind of trouble?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I owe a lot of money.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Was that why you did the two grand? I couldn't help you.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I know that. But you can now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't have any money.  switches on the light. JANI is looking distressed.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Some people I know, they're planning to rob The Golden Lion.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: They mean it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who's they?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: My creditors. One night, around three in the morning, they'll come into the casino -

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Forget it, Jani. It'll never work.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: The point is, they want a man inside.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And I thought you were a bright woman.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Just listen. You don't have to do anything criminal.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Robbery's not criminal?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You don't have to be criminal. A man will come up to your table and deliberately cheat. You'll see him, stop him, and the guy will make a big scene. There'll be chaos. And that's when it'll happen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're serious.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You won't be committing a crime. The man will cheat, you'll just be doing your job, that's all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And I thought you were only after my body.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I've come to know you. You're honest.  I trust you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What'll you do when it all goes wrong?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: It won't.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But if it does.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: You keep the ten thousand pounds.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What ten thousand pounds?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: These people will pay you ten thousand before and ten thousand after. They want someone they can be sure of, an honest dealer. That's the point. Not all dealers are honest. Mr Reynolds will never suspect you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Reynolds? You've done your research.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Next time it'll be my neck.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about my neck?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I want to go back to Cape Town, I want to start again, clean.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can't do it, Jani.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I'm asking you, as a...friend. You'd be saving the life of a friend.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I want you to forget what I said.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait a minute...

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: No, forget it. The bet's off.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How much do you owe?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Let it go.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did they tell you to sleep with me?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I told you, all bets are off.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I have to take the car.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Is it yes?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It doesn't seem fair. You're offering me ten grand in cash but you can't afford a decent place.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Well, life's not fair. We know that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's all relative.  I need the money too.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: The date's not set yet. I'll call you. One last thing: the man you're going to catch cheating, he may get violent. But you know how to deal with cheats.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That bruise has cleared up nicely.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Bruise?  Oh, yes. It's better.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've still got mine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And your hand too.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: I took the bandage off yesterday.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Would you like a drink?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't think we should meet again.

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: It's a shame there aren't more men in the world like you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Jack! It's Jani.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jani! Where are you?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Sun City. I've been meaning to call you for months.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Great. I'm getting married. At least, I think I am.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you solve your problems?

turns.speaker: JANI
turns.text: Yes. I'm all over that now. Jack, hold on a minute. There's someone here who wants to talk to you...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Detective Inspector Ross.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Ross.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who did it? Tell me!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course I recognised him!

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know a cheat when I see one. The man was a cheat.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You've been avoiding me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have I?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I'm Lucy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And what do you do, Lucy?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I'm a witch. A white witch. Why don't we move on?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you going to put a spell on me?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I might.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice car. How much did you pay for it?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Too much. Eighteen hundred.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Turn left at the lights.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Where do you live, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Over the river.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Have you got transport?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I'm going over the river. I'll give you a lift if you like.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: So how do you feel, your first night? I'll bet you're on a high.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice car.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: She's my baby.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How long have you worked at the casino?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Coming up to two years now.  But I was away for six months.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You've done pretty well.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Not bad. I have other interests, of course.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I'm off to a little watering hole. Why don't you join me? Relax.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No thanks, Matt. I need my eight hours.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I'll lay you five to one you won't sleep. In this job you have to unwind. Otherwise it'll kill you. I mean that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Some other time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look Matt, there's something I have to say to you. I saw you cheating.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That Greek guy who won at the end. You paid him out in 25s not 20s.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I don't cheat, Jack. You've got it wrong.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not going to report it.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: What are you, a cop?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If I see you do it again, I'll report it.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I don't get you. Even if it was true, which it isn't, what the fuck difference would it make to you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because if a supervisor knew I'd seen you and I hadn't reported it, I'd lose my job as well. And I can't afford that.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: So it's Mr Clean. Wise up, Jack, this whole business is bent. The casino is nothing but legal theft. And that's OK. It's the system. Half the punters who come in are using stolen money, drug money, they haven't earned it. We earn our money.  I'm on your side, Jack. I don't need an enemy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're talking about complicity.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I don't know what that means. I'm talking about not rocking the boat.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who are these guys?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Mostly people in the casino business. A few drug dealers.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And the girls?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Just girls. What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Vodka. Straight. On the rocks.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Good call. Help yourself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Does Bella come here?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: That bitch? No.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Hey Jack, join us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Don't worry, I won't report you!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm off. I need to sleep.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Loosen up, Jack. If you don't, this job'll get to you. The pressure's too much, believe me, it'll break you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: "The world breaks everyone, and afterwards many are strong in the broken places." Ernest Hemingway.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I can't give you a lift back tonight.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Rough day?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Rough life, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What happened to Bella?

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: I'll tell you later.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: What? You know what happened to me, don't you? That bitch Bella shopped me. I'd like to beat the shit out of her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'd like to buy you a drink.

turns.speaker: MATT
turns.text: Cheers. Happy New Year. I really like you, Jacko, you're so fucking straight.  Hey, you haven't changed your clothes!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, that's a late bet.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What are you talking about? It's 11, I've won. With this lady.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You've won with the two chips you placed earlier, but the third chip was a late bet.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I put them on together.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm afraid that's not so, sir.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You don't recognise me? You had me barred. You fucking little worm.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait a minute. You got yourself barred.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It was you, you shit.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: David Reynolds, I'm the Manager here. Sit down, John.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: You've been recommended by the management here. They know your father. He has a bit of a reputation, hasn't he?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Has he?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: In any case, I understand you've had some previous experience... in South Africa.  You'll find the rules a little different here. Before we start, you haven't got a police record, have you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Where did you go to school?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was at Beadles.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I don't think I know that one. Private, I suppose.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: There are three types of casino in the U.K. High volume. Small faction. And MOTR. That's middle of the road. Us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you have a Salon Prive?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We tried. But there wasn't enough business. The punters like company.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I have to assume the serial numbers on the bowl and cylinder correspond.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We check every four days.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why four? And not three or five?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: It's the procedure here. Now sort the chips.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stacks of 20. Rows of 5.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Any exceptions?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: 25 pounds or 25 pence in fours.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Give me 365.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You use two alternating, don't you?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where's the magnet?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: They've been tested.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Haven't you forgotten something?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Wipe your hands.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Not with your own cloth. Besides, your pockets will be stitched.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What happens if I want to sneeze?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: You won't. Not without permission.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: How many aces are left?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Five.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I make it six.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Five.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What makes you so sure?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's a rule. Always stand by your first count. The odds are you're right.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Good call.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You want me to check?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I said good call.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Let me just run through a few things. As a dealer you never gamble, not anywhere. We'll need your picture.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: For the database. It can be accessed by every casino in the country. We have the same system for punters.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Ever?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't gamble, Mr Reynolds.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Next point. Friendships between croupiers inside or outside the casino are discouraged. Relationships with females working here are expressly forbidden.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We had the same rule at Sun City, but it was impossible to check.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: This isn't South Africa. We'd know, because someone would report it. Believe me, someone always does.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Does know? Or does report? What would happen if I knew something like that and didn't report it?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We'd know. There are no secrets in this casino. You'd be punished.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: First offence: verbal warning. Second offence: written warning. That one's filed and sometimes copied to the Gaming Board. My discretion. Third offence: you're sacked on the spot. You'd never work in a casino in this country again.  There's another rule: you're forbidden to talk to or recognise a punter outside the casino. If you see someone who's gambled here, even if it's just casually on the street, you must ignore him. Or her. You're not married, are you?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Girlfriend?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: She's not in the gaming business is she?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: This is our Crow's Nest. I'm showing it to you now, but you'll never see it again.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Very impressive.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We have tapes in here that go back six months. Let me show you something.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: You can start Monday week.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: That hair will have to go.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I just want the job.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Jack, you're not the usual type we get here.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Why don't you take a break, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right, Mr Reynolds.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Mr Tchai always likes to play at that table, and only with Bella.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Does he win?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: He's a good customer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's paying out in stacks of 25.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I can see.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Thanks for the information.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A pleasure. Pity about Bella.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: She was a real asset. But what could I do?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: How do you feel, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bruised.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Take your time. Two weeks. Three if you need it. We'll pay you sick leave. I don't want to lose you. You're a good man. Here...

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: I have a reduced drive reading of seven thousand.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Right, that checks out here.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: Ninety seven million, minus eight, corrected to mass critical.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: I read that with a quantum increase of seven.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: I'm getting this flickering light on one of my panels.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: What flickering light?

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: The one on unit... oh, I think it's GMR twelve zero zero.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Oh. What's wrong now?

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: I'm not sure. I think something is fucked up somewhere in the ship, though.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: I hope it's not the oven again.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Remember when the artificial gravity, went out in the toilet?

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: There she is. Definite 99%-plus probability that the planet is going to deviate from its normal orbit in another twelve thousand rotations. It'll spiral in toward its sun, and --

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Eventual supernova.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: I can tell, the damn thing just doesn't understand.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Look, bomb...

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: What's he doin'?

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: I think he's talking to it.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: The key!

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Key? Key? What is the key?

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: No, no, the key, the key to the fail- safe lock!

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Key?

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: Where's the fail-safe key?

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: The key!

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: Where is it? What did you do with it?

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: I don't have it. I don't know where it is.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: You must have it, you idiot, we can stop the bomb!

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: The key, goddamit, the key!

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Christ, twenty seconds, Christ!

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: Where is the key?

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: We're gonna die, Boiler. We're gonna die.

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: It didn't go off.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: BOILER
turns.text: It didn't go off.

turns.speaker: PINBACK
turns.text: Boiler, we're alive. My heart.
